summary: The Unemployment Insurance Modernization and Recession Readiness Act (S. 2312) aims to modernize unemployment compensation benefits. Key provisions include full federal funding of extended unemployment benefits, improved triggers for those benefits, and increases in the number of weeks available during high unemployment. The bill also addresses modernization of regular unemployment benefits such as minimum benefit levels and part-time work considerations. A new 'jobseeker allowance' is established, providing assistance to unemployed individuals, and emergency enhanced unemployment compensation is introduced during declared emergencies. The bill includes various effective dates, most beginning in 2027.
